intro: Pratia angulata var. obovata, commonly known as the broad-leafed pratia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its obovate, glossy leaves that are often arranged in opposite pairs. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or sandy environments. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in suitable climates.
